title: 110_hr5525
content: The Act is titled the "Inclusion of Veteran Service Organizations in the National Veterans Business Development Corporation Board Act." It aims to improve the National Veterans Business Development Corporation. The Small Business Act is amended to increase the number of voting members on the Board to 11, with the President appointing 7 members after considering recommendations. Up to 5 members can be from the same political party. The Small Business Act is amended to increase the Board's voting members to 11, with the President appointing 7 members based on recommendations. Congressional appointments for the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship and the Committee on Veterans' Affairs are also specified. The Small Business Act is amended to increase the Board's voting members to 11, with the President appointing 7 members based on recommendations. The Committee on Veterans' Affairs of the House of Representatives shall appoint 4 members who are representatives of veterans' service organizations. The presidents and directors of veterans business resource centers in Flint, St. Louis, and Boston will provide expertise to the Board. The Small Business Act is amended to increase the Board's voting members to 11, with the President appointing 7 members based on recommendations. The Committee on Veterans' Affairs of the House of Representatives shall appoint 4 members who are representatives of veterans' service organizations. The presidents and directors of veterans business resource centers in Flint, St. Louis, and Boston will provide expertise and advice to the Board of Directors. Amendments include removal of members with approval from the Board and relevant committees, and all Board meetings must be conducted in public. The Board of Directors must hold public meetings, with minutes available on the Corporation's website. Stakeholders will receive notice of meetings and agendas. A conforming amendment removes presidential appointment authority. Congressional appointments must be made within 90 days. Two appointments must be made under section 33(c)(2) of the Small Business Act within 90 days of this Act. Additional appointments will follow the expiration of the first two terms.
